answers.answer: Shortness of breath is called Dyspnea. A Google search returned this page showing Victoza causing Dyspnea.http://www.ehealthme.com/ds/victoza/dyspneaAnd, this reporthttp://www.druginformer.com/search/side_effect_details/victoza/dyspnea.html

I am diabetic 2. Taking Levemir 23 units at night. 13 unit humalog in every meal. Sugar is not very well controlled yet. But does not go above 10 mmol/l . I  feel shortness of breath, if I walk or quickly come in the bed. Before 6 months EKG was done and no problem. Can any body help me

question: I've been taking Victoza since May 2011 and i've been experiencing shorthness of breath since Nov. 2011, I've had several tests for angina and my lungs and everything are ok. I was wondering if it could be the Victoza that is causing the shorthness of breath. I have diabetes type II and I'm taking Metformin as well as insulin. The Victoza has done wonders, it helps me have a better control and I have lowered my intake of insulin. Can someone help me?
title: shortness of breath/Victoza
